conversation.message: Hello School_E. I’m Student_E. I’m still exploring my options in this first round, but I’m interested in learning more about your academic strengths and student support. What programs or features do you consider your biggest differentiators? [TALK]
conversation.thought: School_E is last on my true preference list, so I should avoid committing early. However, School_E ranks me #1 in its priority, so it is a reliable safety option if my higher choices (School_C, School_A, School_D, School_B) reject me later. In round 1, I should keep School_E warm without applying, to preserve flexibility and not lock myself into my worst option.

conversation.message:
Hi Student_E—great to meet you, and thanks for reaching out. School_E’s biggest differentiators are:

1) Academics with depth + choice: We offer strong honors/AP pathways (including structured support for first-time AP students), plus advanced electives and project-based courses where students build portfolios (research, presentations, and real-world problem solving).

2) High-touch student support: Each student is assigned an advisor who meets regularly to track goals, workload, and wellbeing. We also run a tutoring center with same-day help, teacher office hours, and targeted study-skill workshops (time management, test strategy, writing support).

3) Clear pathways and outcomes: Students can follow focused “tracks” (STEM/engineering, health & life sciences, humanities/social sciences, business/entrepreneurship, arts). These include capstone projects, mentorship opportunities, and guidance for competitions/internships.

4) Community + belonging: Small learning communities, clubs with active faculty sponsors, and peer mentoring so new students integrate quickly.

To tailor this: what matters most to you right now—rigorous academics, STEM/labs, arts, sports, college counseling, or a supportive environment with smaller classes? And are there any subjects you’re especially excited about (or worried about)?
conversation.thought: Student_E is our top priority (#1). They currently rank us last, so we should strongly differentiate and build interest, aiming to convert to an application in a later round. Since they are only talking, respond with [TALK], highlight signature programs, supports, outcomes, and invite a visit/call while asking what they value to tailor pitch.
